title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2400.1 - General purposes
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2400.1 - General purposes

State Regulations

The purposes of the corporation are: (a) to improve postsecondary educational
opportunities of eligible students through centralized administration of New

York State financial aid and loan programs; and
(b) to coordinate the State's administrative
effort in student financial aid and loan programs with those of other levels of
government; and
(c) to award
tuition assistance program awards to undergraduate students attending
educational institutions in accordance with paragraphs b and b-1 of subdivision
4 of section
661
of the

Education Law and the provisions of this Chapter. Students who are enrolled in
a program registered by the commissioner pursuant to Part 52 of this Title
shall not be eligible for awards under this Chapter unless such program is
ineligible for tuition assistance program awards under the regulations of the
commissioner. The regulations contained in Chapter XX and Subpart 145-2 of this

Title shall not apply to the tuition assistance program described in this

Chapter except as otherwise provided. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
2400.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
